oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Union earthworks at Fort Hill in Waverly, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These earthworks above the historic business district of Waverly, Tenn. were the headquarters of the 13th US Colored Troops (USCT) from the fall of 1863 to the end of the war. This unit had responsibility for guarding the army-operated railroad, formerly the Nashville and Northwestern, that ran from Johnsonville on the Tennessee River east to Nashville and protecting it from depredations by local Confederate guerillas.
